intro: Gnaphalium retortum, commonly known as the twisted cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium retortum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
